column1: CANTICUM GRADUUM DĀVĪD: Ecce quam bonum et quam jūcundum habitāre frātrēs in ūnum.^A gradual canticle of David: Behold how good and how pleasant it is for brethren to dwell together in unity.

column4: Quod descendit in ōram vestīmentī ejus;^Like the precious ointment on the head
column5: that ran down upon the beard
column7: Which ran down to the skirt of his garment;

column2: quī descendit in montem Sion. Quoniam illīc mandāvit Dominus benedictiōnem
column3: et vītam usque in saeculum.^as the dew of Hermon
column4: which descendeth upon mount Sion. For there the Lord hath commanded blessing
